skill.name: aeon
skill.description: This skill should be used for time series machine learning tasks including classification, regression, clustering, forecasting, anomaly detection, segmentation, and similarity search. Use when working with temporal data, sequential patterns, or time-indexed observations requiring specialized algorithms beyond standard ML approaches. Particularly suited for univariate and multivariate time series analysis with scikit-learn compatible APIs.
skill.summary: This skill should be used for time series machine learning tasks including classification, regressio...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill with no executable code. All 516 static findings are false positives - the analyzer misinterpreted markdown documentation code examples as executable code. No security concerns identified.

content.user_title: Analyze time series data with Aeon
content.value_statement: Aeon is a scikit-learn compatible Python toolkit for time series machine learning. It provides state-of-the-art algorithms for classification, regression, clustering, forecasting, anomaly detection, segmentation, and similarity search.
actual_capabilities: Classify time series data using convolution-based, deep learning, and distance-based algorithms
Forecast future values with ARIMA and neural network forecasters
Detect anomalies and change points in temporal sequences
Cluster similar time series patterns without labels
Search for similar motifs and discords in time series data
limitations: Requires numpy and scikit-learn compatible data format (n_samples, n_channels, n_timepoints)
Deep learning methods require GPU for optimal performance on large datasets
Not suitable for non-temporal data analysis

use_cases.title: Build predictive models
use_cases.description: Classify sensor readings, predict equipment failures, and forecast demand using time series ML algorithms.

use_cases.title: Analyze temporal patterns
use_cases.description: Detect anomalies, segment time series, and find recurring patterns in scientific measurement data.

use_cases.title: Deploy time series solutions
use_cases.description: Integrate scikit-learn compatible time series models into production pipelines with familiar APIs.

prompt_templates.title: Basic classification
prompt_templates.prompt: Use aeon to classify time series data. Load the GunPoint dataset, train a RocketClassifier, and evaluate accuracy on the test set.

prompt_templates.title: Anomaly detection
prompt_templates.prompt: Use aeon to detect anomalies in time series data. Use the STOMP detector with window_size=50 and identify points with anomaly scores above the 95th percentile.

prompt_templates.title: Forecasting
prompt_templates.prompt: Use aeon to forecast future values. Train an ARIMA model and predict the next 5 time points. Show how to evaluate the forecast accuracy.

prompt_templates.title: Custom pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a sklearn pipeline using aeon transformations. Normalize time series data, extract ROCKET features, and train a RandomForest classifier.

output_examples.input: Classify time series data using MiniRocketClassifier
output: â€¢ MiniRocketClassifier provides fast, scalable time series classification
â€¢ Uses simplified ROCKET kernels for efficient feature extraction
â€¢ Compatible with sklearn pipelines and model selection tools
â€¢ Typical accuracy on standard benchmarks: 85-95%

best_practices: Normalize time series data using aeon.transformations.collection.Normalizer before training
Start with MiniRocketClassifier for prototyping, then experiment with HIVECOTEV2 for maximum accuracy
Use cross-validation to tune hyperparameters, especially distance parameters for distance-based methods
anti_patterns: Using deep learning classifiers on small datasets (less than 1000 samples)
Skipping data normalization, which most algorithms require for optimal performance
Using raw time series without checking the expected input shape (n_samples, n_channels, n_timepoints)

faq.question: What is the difference between classification and regression?
faq.answer: Classification predicts categorical labels. Regression predicts continuous values. Both use similar algorithms but differ in target type.

faq.question: Which classifier should I start with?
faq.answer: MiniRocketClassifier offers the best speed-to-accuracy balance for most datasets. Use it for initial prototyping.

faq.question: How do I handle missing values?
faq.answer: Use aeon.transformations.collection.SimpleImputer to fill missing values before applying other transformations.

faq.question: Can I use aeon with sklearn pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes, aeon transformers and classifiers are fully scikit-learn compatible and work with Pipeline and GridSearchCV.

faq.question: What distance metrics are available?
faq.answer: DTW, Euclidean, Manhattan, LCSS, ERP, EDR, and others. DTW is most common for time series similarity.

faq.question: Does aeon support multivariate time series?
faq.answer: Yes, most algorithms support multivariate input with shape (n_samples, n_channels, n_timepoints).
